funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER PUBLIC BUILDING & IMPROVEMENT RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance a stationary pump for the city of Minnewaukan, N.D. The city currently has a pump that is run by Power Take-Off (PTO) with a tractor, but the city does not have its own tractor and has to rent a tractor to pump water. Inside the levee is where the city would need to put the pump as this is where the excess rain and or snow melt occurs. This area is where the water pools up and starts to work its way along the inside of the levee and eventually finds its way into the backyards of residents that are near the area. It would be more beneficial to purchase a different pump that is not run by PTO.

funding_code: NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES COMMUNITY FACILITY GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
naics_description: ALL OTHER MISCELLANEOUS SCHOOLS AND INSTRUCTION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance street improvements to United Tribes Technical College, located in Bismarck, ND. The project entails a reconstruction and rehabilitation of portions of All Nations Circle at the intersection of University Drive. The new access would be moved approximately 500 feet to the north and would be a new asphalt roadway and sidewalk elements. Pedestrian access across University Drive would also be moved. The facility currently does not readily provide room for expansion of signage, pedestrian elements and limited visibility due to being up against the property line. The entire campus of United Tribes Technical College, which includes about 638 students and faculty/staff, along with any prospective students or visitors would benefit from this improvement. Previous funding includes a $181,367 Rural Development grant and United Tribes Technical College will also be contributing $1,088,185 of their own funds to the project.

project_name: Water and Sanitary Sewer System Improvement District No. 2020-1
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) COMBINATION W&W
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance upgrades to a water tower and various water system maintenance items in Hunter, North Dakota. The removal and replacement of the interior and exterior coatings, structural repairs on the water tower, a new mixer in the water tower, as well as a monitoring system and a valve will also be replaced in the pump house is also proposed to help with the deficiencies within the water system. The manholes on either side of the sewer line have been sinking progressively in the last few years, to the point that sewage is not flowing properly. By replacing the manholes as well as some sewer mains near the manholes, installing monitoring system in the lift station and replacing crossover piping between the lagoons will assist with the deficiencies within the sewer system.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance two new rotating sirens with battery backup. The city currently hasfour stationary sirens that are over 35 years old plus one rotating siren. The four stationary sirens are unable to function during power outages. If there were to be a power outage, 4 out of 5 sirens currently in use would be unable to operate. This would leave a large portion of the city without emergency notification. Additional funding includes a $14,950 applicant contribution and a $14,950 pledge from a local group.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to complete an envelope restoration project to make repairs to the exterior of the Elgin/New Leipzig School.The restoration and repairs will include masonry repair, tuck pointing mortar, caulking and sealants, and cent patching to make the building more airtight.The restoration will reduce the risks associated with water penetration, air leakage, and thermal performance while increasing durability and energy efficiency of the building.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install eight unit ventilators for the Elgin/New Leipzig school. These units will replace existing units that have exceeded their useful life and improve air quality for students and teachers. This project is located in Elgin, North Dakota and will benefit the 1371 rural residents that live in the Elgin/New Leipzig school district.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace nine unit ventilators and remove asbestos tiles from the gymnasium school at the Elgin/New Leipzig Public School. The Elgin/New Leipzig school district serves an area with a population of 1371 residents. Replacing the ventilators in the high school will help to improve the indoor air quality of the building. Improved air quality should also decrease the likely hood of viruses being spread in the school building. The high school gymnasium floor is asbestos tile and is original to the building. The plan is to abate the high school gymnasium, removing the asbestos. Then the floor will be replaced with a type of flooring that would improve the safety and health of the building.

naics_description: ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchasea transit van for the Wishek Home for the Aged. The new transit van will be smaller and more efficient than the existing one andwill be equipped to provide services to individuals needing mobility accommodations, along with other seniors who require transportation to medical and other appointments outside of the Wishek Living Center.Thetransit van will enable up to four or more individuals to be served at one time. Itwill be equipped with a retractable track set, a manual ramp, seat belts for wheelchairs, ratchet tie downs for wheelchairs, ADA lighting and a side entry ADA conversion, andwill be much safer and more efficient.

naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
naics_description: ALL OTHER MISCELLANEOUS SCHOOLS AND INSTRUCTION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the campus building at Nueta Hidatsa Sahnish College in New Town, ND. Renovations will retrofit the current temperature and energy managements system, install destratification fans with ionization, and landscape around the outside of the building.The newly commissioned temperature system will be easier to operate and maintain a more consistent temperature in the building. The destratification fans will improve the air quality in the building and help to reduce mold and other impurities in the air. Landscaping around the building will improve water flow away from the main building. The landscaping with remediate an issue with water entering the building after heavy rains and also assist in deterring mold in the building.

project_name: Connection to Walsh Rural Water District
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to connect the city of Drayton, North Dakota to Walsh Rural Water District. The current intake was constructed in 1994 and the water treatment plant was originally constructed in 1967 and reconditioned in 1995. Both facilities and the reconditioned components are nearing the end of their useful service life. The proposed project would supply finished water to Drayton via a pipeline from the Walsh Rural Water District originating from the Park River water treatment plant.

project_name: Connection to Walsh Rural Water District

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND ENERGY EFF IMPROV GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a more energy efficient grain drying system. DMB Farms, Inc. is a family farm, raising small grains near Rugby, ND. This project will save the business $26,030 per year and will replace 434,529 kWh (40 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power 40 homes.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for renovations of the main elevator at the Good Samaritan Hospital Association in Rugby, ND. The existing elevator is aged and has a history of mechanical breakdowns. Due to the age of the elevator, parts have become obsolete and the elevator cannot be timely repaired. When the elevator is not operational, customers must be taken to another elevator on the opposite side of the facility, which round trip, is about two city blocks. The renovations of the elevator will include installing new controls, upgrading electrical service and fire system monitoring. The renovated elevator will help ensure reliable, safe access to the facilitys long-term care patients and visitors, and access to the rehabilitation and wellness facilities. This project is located in Rugby, ND and will benefit approximately 4,357 rural residents that live in Pierce County.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install an updated security system for the Pierce County Jail (Heart of America Correction and Treatment Center). The project includes updates to the current security system software, updates to cameras, & storage servers. The software upgrade will allow greater usage of current systems like securing doors, cameras, and door access. The camera upgrade would replace outdated analog cameras with hi-resolution digital cameras. The server update will improve memory capacity from 14 to 30 days of storage.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) COMBINATION W&W
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace a portion of the city of Rugbys water, sanitary sewer, and storm sewer lines. Larger water mains will be used to provide the system with capacity to accommodate fire flow demands. Sanitary sewer mains and manholes are cracking and collapsing, causing extensive and costly repairs. Storm sewer lines are heaving and damaging the pipework and roadway over the top. This project is the first of a multi-step plan to update the city of Rugbys water, sanitary sewer, and storm sewer lines which will provide their 2,876 residents with a sustainable system for many years to come.

The project is located in Belcourt, North Dakota.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY)  W&W 306C-NATIVE AMERICAN-COMB W&W
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install new water supply and sewer system pipes for the residents of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians in Belcourt, North Dakota. Current water mains are mostly asbestos cement pipe and the sewer mains are clay tile/asbestos cement which have been failing. With the completion of this project, which will replace the deteriorated water and sewer mains, constituents in the city of Belcourt will see improved water supply and sewer services. This project will benefit 208 residents.

project_name: East Belcourt Sewer and Water Phase 3
funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) 306C-NATIVE AMERICAN-WASTE ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct sewer improvements for the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians in Belcourt County, N.D. The East Belcourt area to be improved has many deficiencies due to the age of the sewer pipe. With the completion of the project, the aged clay tile sewer mains and sagging pipes will be replaced with new PVC pipe. In addition, new manholes will be installed. The replacement collection system will result in a more efficient sewer system for the area and provide safe waste disposal for residents.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) 306C-NATIVE AMERICAN-WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) 306C-NATIVE AMERICAN-WASTE ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct lagoon improvements for the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians in Belcourt County, ND. The Shell Valley lagoon area to be improved has many deficiencies that inadequately treat the wastewater in the system. With the completion of the project, the waste at the Shell Valley lagoon will be relocated to a consolidated wastewater treatment system and the lagoons located over the Shell Valley aquifer, the main drinking water source for the tribe, will be abandoned to protect the water source. In addition, the consolidated system will allow for additional users to be connected, providing safe waste disposal for residents. This project will benefit 8,669 residents.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a water reservoir and booster station for the residents of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians in Belcourt County, N.D. The water system has experienced catastrophic failures in water supply due to the lack of a raw water reservoir and booster station. With the completion of the project, the reservoir will provide a reliable supply of water to the water treatment plant. In addition, water pre-treatment at the reservoir will allow for the removal of contaminants to provide a safe and reliable water supply to residents.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) 306C-NATIVE AMERICAN-WASTE ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct lagoon improvements for the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians in Belcourt County, North Dakota. The Shell Valley lagoon area to be improved has many deficiencies that inadequately treat the wastewater in the system. With the completion of the project, the waste at the Shell Valley lagoon will be relocated to a consolidated wastewater treatment system and the lagoons located over the Shell Valley aquifer, the main drinking water source for the tribe, will be abandoned to protect the water source. In addition, the consolidated system will allow for additional users to be connected, providing safe waste disposal for residents.

With the completion of this project, which will replace the deteriorated water and sewer mains, constituents in the city of Belcourt will see improved water supply and sewer services.

naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install infrastructure to the Sitting Bull College campus. Funds will be used for additional paving improvements between the Building Trade Center and the adjacent Transit Center part of campus include the completion of hard surface paving from back to front of the facility, which will help alleviate ponding issues. The new paving will also allow for additional hard surface parking adjacent to the building. These upgrades are very important for the college, so they can maintain their campus and provide a quality education to their students. This project is located in Fort Yates, North Dakota and will benefit the approximately 8,300 residents that live on the Standing Rock Reservation.

The new watermain will allow for residents to have access to a safe water supply from the rural water system. This project will benefit 253 residents.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to the South Central Dakota counties by assisting entrepreneurs and innovators in developing and launching successful businesses in North Dakota. Technical assistance includes Entrepreneurship Advocacy Initiatives, customized training, entrepreneur meetings and one on one business technical assistance.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct an approximate 110,000 square foot facility for Anne Carlsen Center in Jamestown, North Dakota. The new facility will provide modern, flexible, and technology enhanced spaces to allow the Anne Carlsen Center to provide its unique care model for its residents/students. It will support 34 individuals (24 will be individuals with medically complex needs and 10 will be individuals with intellectual, developmental and behavioral challenges). The new facility will provide vastly improved staff and support spaces which will improve the training, workflow, and ability for focused and uninterrupted work for the over 350 staff members employed at the facility. The new facility will incorporate six major departments that each serve a different and unique need. The six departments include residential, education, therapy, aquatic therapy, administration, and support. This project is located in Jamestown, North Dakota and will benefit approximately 51,000 rural residents that live in the surrounding eight counties.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)

It will support 34 individuals (24 will be individuals with medically complex needs and 10 will be individuals with intellectual, developmental and behavioral challenges). The new facility will provide vastly improved staff and support spaces which will improve the training, workflow, and ability for focused and uninterrupted work for the over 350 staff members employed at the facility. The new facility will incorporate six major departments that each serve a different and unique need. The six departments include residential, education, therapy, aquatic therapy, administration, and support. This project is located in Jamestown, North Dakota and will benefit approximately 51,000 rural residents that live in the surrounding eight counties.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an automated arm garbage truck, compatible garbage receptacles, software pertinent to use of truck/receptacles, and diesel fuel tank for the city of Valley City in Barnes County, North Dakota. This equipment will be used in the collection of waste materials through the city. This project will be instrumental in helping the waste management for over approximately 6,500 city residents.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a utility digger truck for the city of Valley City in Barnes County, North Dakota. This equipment will be used by the electrical department for maintaining the electrical poles and lines that serve the residents of Valley City. This project will be instrumental in maintaining electrical services for over approximately 6,500 city residents.

project_name: Water and Sanitary Sewer System Improvement District No. 2020-1
funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) COMBINATION W&W
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: The Rural Development investment will be used to finance coatings, structural repair, and addition of a mixer to the water tower, monitoring system for the water tower and lift station, repair of settling manholes and replacement of crossover piping between the lagoons for the water and sewer systems that services the city of Hunter, North Dakota. On a recent water tower inspection, it was noted that adhesion would be a concern if another overcoat was proposed. The interior coating has pinhole corrosion below the high-water line. The removal and replacement of the interior and exterior coatings and some structural repairs on the water tower, a new mixer to be installed in the water tower as well as a monitoring system and a valve will also be replaced in the pump house have been proposed to help with the deficiencies within the water system. The manholes on either side of the sewer line have been sinking progressively in the last few years, to the point that sewage is not flowing properly. There is also a concentrated point of infiltration on a sewer line approximately two blocks east of this line. The crossover piping between the lagoon cells is not functioning, which is causing issues with treatment. Additional funding includes $1,000,000 in Rural Development loans and grants. Total project cost has been updated to: $1,500,000.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to add an addition andrenovate the Northwood Deaconess Health Center (NDHC). The updated facility will include major renovations to the hospital, including the emergency room, procedure suite, imaging, lab, pharmacy, and business office. The hospital addition will provide for 25 beds, of which nine will be acute care beds and 16 will be swing beds to provide senior living space. The clinic will undergo some renovations to the existing waiting/reception area and the business office area. There will be a new entry canopy off the east facade with a renovated patient registration and waiting area for combined use by the hospital, procedures, imaging, lab, clinic, and physical therapy, as well as the business office. There will be a new addition for rehab and a community wellness center. The existing dining and activities area of the senior living space will be renovated to provide conference space and admin space. The north end of the assisted living building will be renovated to provide three two-bedroom assisted living apartments. Based on the proposed construction, there will be the ability to add the following much needed services: computerized tomography scanning, endoscopy, colonoscopy, infusion, and potential future services of mammography, dermatology, and orthopedics. This project is located in Northwood, North Dakota and will benefit approximately 3,800 rural residents living in Grand Forks County.

naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace a unit ventilator and make needed repairs to the tunnel system at the Elgin/New Leipzig Public School. The Elgin/New Leipzig school district serves an area with a population of 1,371 residents. Replacing this ventilator completes the plan to replace all the existing outdated ventilators in the high school which should greatly improve the indoor air quality of the building. Improved air quality should also decrease the likelihood of viruses being spread in the school building. The tunnel system needs to be cleaned out and repairs made as there has been standing water in the tunnel after rains which has resulted in mold which presents a health and safety hazard.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist with the purchase of equipment and payment of professional fees related to the construction of a 60,098 square foot Critical Access Hospital/Clinic/Care Center for Cooperstown Medical Center (CMC). The new facility will include a heliport, emergency room, lab, radiology, clinic, physical therapy, pharmacy, administration, and building support spaces. The building will be divided into two distinct areas dividing the primary hospital functions from the clinic, physical therapy, pharmacy and administrative areas. A third area of the new facility will be for the care center. This project is located in Cooperstown, North Dakota and will benefit approximately 4,900 rural residents in Griggs County.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER PUBLIC BUILDING & IMPROVEMENT RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance a garbage truck for the city of Napoleon, North Dakota. The city of Napoleon currently has one smaller capacity garbage truck that is a 2007 Sterling Truck. The city used to haul its garbage to a different town, but that town is no longer accepting outside refuse in its landfill. This has led to Napoleon hauling their garbage to a larger city instead. Due to smaller capacity of their existing garbage truck, they have to make the trip to the larger city two times a week. This is costing Napoleon additional expenses in contract services and salary. The 2007 Sterling truck is pushing 90,000 miles. The garbage truck body has had many problems. Specifically, these garbage bodies can only compress garbage so many times before the metal gets fatigued. The city of Napoleon would like to purchase a new garbage truck that has more capacity to hold more refuse, therefore cutting down the number of trips from two to one to the larger citys landfill. With the trips to the larger city they put 20,000 miles on the truck, by up-sizing the garbage body on the new truck they anticipate cutting their mileage in half.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a payloader, motor grader, and three generators. Logan County needs to replace a current payloader and motor grader because they are older, worn units that are experiencing frequent break downs and have become unreliable when needed for emergency snow removal as well as for routine use when needed for road repair and road maintenance. Logan County is also planning to purchase three new stand-by generators for the county highway department shops which are needed to open the large overhead doors (in case of a power failure) to remove equipment when crews may be called upon to clear roads for emergency ambulance, fire or law enforcement personnel. This project will provide upgraded and reliable service for years to come.

project_name: Sanitary Sewer Replacement District 2021 and SEARCH Grant
funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace sewer mains and install a gravity outlet on the west side of the city of Napoleon. There is a documented health and sanitary issue with the aged vitrified clay pipes that are deteriorating, with some pipes exhibiting minor to severe groundwater infiltration through joints, lateral connections and cracks. The groundwater infiltration washes away the soil from around the pipe, thereby causing the pipes to shift. The sanitary collection system was televised and the vitrified clay pipes showed numerous deficiencies such as sags, offset joints, cracked and broken pipe and penetrating roots. The city has experienced issues in the services including blockages and failures. This project will solve most of the existing problems with the sanitary sewer collection system and lower the impacts of the groundwater table and the ongoing costs that go into managing the groundwater. Additional funding includes $1,000,000 in Rural Development loans and grants.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to remove and replace the existing water tower, and relocate it to the southeast section of the city of Napoleon, N.D. Water main would be installed to create a continuous 8 inch water main loop to the existing larger water mains on the west side of Napoleon. Some new hydrants and gate valves would also be installed. Currently, the city has only 50,000-gallons in storage. This shows that the current system does not provide the required storage to meet minimum design standards. The addition of a new care facility in town will only increase the discrepancy between the current available water storage and new required minimum water storage. In order to meet both the citys minimum fire protection requirement of 1,200 gallons per minute and plan for future growth, an 8 inch water main needs to be extended to the site and looped.

This network will connect 1,151 people, 67 businesses, four public schools and 91 farms in Richland and Wibaux counties in Montana, and in Dunn, McKenzie and McLean counties in North Dakota. Reservation Telephone Cooperative will make high-speed internet affordable by participating in the Federal Communications Commissions Affordable Connectivity Program. This will give eligible residents a discount of up to $30 per month. This project will serve the Fort Berthold Reservation Tribal Entity.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace a Critical Access Hospital and Medical Facility for Good Samaritan Hospital Association, dba Heart of America Medical Center in Rugby, North Dakota. The new facility will include a critical access hospital, emergency room, procedure suite, imaging, lab, pharmacy, and business office. The hospital will provide for 25 beds, of which six will be acute care beds, one observation bed and 18 swing beds to provide senior living space. The facility will include a clinic area and allow for the continuation of much needed medical services to Rugby and the surrounding communities. funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE REAP ZONE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATION OF URBAN PLANNING AND COMMUNITY AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to effectively address the need for the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa by developing sustainable initiatives for its members that will directly contribute to the local economy, local foods, and local food sovereignty. It is the goal of this project to assist small farmers, start-up and existing entrepreneurs to create and expand individual opportunities through supportive services including technical assistance, training, and hand-on experience.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to build a storage unit to house the districts mobile health clinic. The mobile health clinic helps 14,000 residents in Rolette County access health care, nutritional assistance and vaccines. The storage unit will protect the clinic from extreme weather conditions.

borrower_name: TURTLE MOUNTAIN BAND OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS
funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install solar panels and electronic marquee sign at the Byron Dorgan Youth Wellness Center. The proposed improvements will reduce the financial burden of energy costs in operating the facility through the purchase and use of solar panels to help power the facility as well as display important community information using an electric marquee sign. The center serves the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians by providing many amenities that facilitate the improved health and wellness of Tribal youth and current members. The project is located in Belcourt, North Dakota and will benefit the 8,669 members of the Turtle Mountain Reservation.

borrower_name: TURTLE MOUNTAIN BAND OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS
funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install solar panels and electronic marquee sign at the Byron Dorgan Youth Wellness Center. The proposed improvements will reduce the financial burden of energy costs in operating the facility through the purchase and use of solar panels to help power the facility as well as display important community information using an electric marquee sign. The center serves the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians by providing many amenities that facilitate the improved health and wellness of Tribal youth and current members. The project is located in Belcourt, North Dakota and will benefit the 8,669 members of the Turtle Mountain Reservation.

borrower_name: TURTLE MOUNTAIN RECOVERY CENTER LAND HC
funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a 34,000 square foot substance use disorder treatment center for Turtle Mountain Recovery Center Land Holding Company, a tribally chartered non-profit. The facility will consist of a 16 bed residential unit, counseling areas and group therapy space for the inpatient and outpatient treatment of abuse of opiates, alcohol and other substances for the members of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians. The building is designed to allow for additional expansion as needed. Construction is expected to start soon and be completed by the fall of 2024. This project is located near Belcourt, North Dakota on the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indian Reservation and will benefit approximately 8,600 rural residents.

With the completion of this project, which will replace the deteriorated water and sewer mains, constituents in the city of Belcourt will see improved water supply and sewer services.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a water main from Kenel, South Dakota to the North Dakota border to benefits the residents of the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe. The new water main will allow for residents to have access to a safe water supply from the rural water system. This project will benefit 253 residents.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to south central North Dakota counties by assisting entrepreneurs and innovators in developing and launching successful businesses in North Dakota. Technical assistance includes entrepreneurship advocacy initiatives, customized training, entrepreneur meetings and one on one business technical assistance.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional financing for the construction of an approximate 110,000 square foot facility for Anne Carlsen Center in Jamestown, North Dakota. The new facility will provide modern, flexible, and technology enhanced spaces to allow the Anne Carlsen Center to provide its unique care model for its residents/students. It will support 34 individuals (24 will be individuals with medically complex needs and 10 will be individuals with intellectual, developmental and behavioral challenges). The new facility will provide vastly improved staff and support spaces which will improve the training, workflow, and ability for focused and uninterrupted work for the over 350 staff members employed at the facility. The new facility will incorporate six major departments that each serve a different and unique need. The six departments include residential, education, therapy, aquatic therapy, administration, and support.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional financing for the construction of a 110,000 square foot facility for Anne Carlsen Center in Jamestown, North Dakota. The facility will provide modern, flexible, and technology enhanced spaces to allow the Anne Carlsen Center to provide its unique care model for its residents/students. It will support 34 individuals (24 will be individuals with medically complex needs and 10 will be individuals with intellectual, developmental, and behavioral challenges). The new facility will provide vastly improved staff and support spaces which will improve the training, workflow, and ability for focused and uninterrupted work for the over 350 staff members employed at the facility. The facility will incorporate six major departments that each serve a different and unique need. The six departments include residential, education, therapy, aquatic therapy, administration, and support.

funding_code: COMBINATION CF DIRECT LOAN/GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a city pickup and plow for the 126 residents of the city of Bisbee. The city of Bisbee needs to replace their existing city pickup which is almost 40 years old and has reached the end of its useful life. The new pickup and plow will be used for snow removal as well as for general city maintenance. This project will provide upgraded and reliable service for years to come.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a city tractor with a loader and snowblower for the 126 residents of the City of Bisbee. The City of Bisbee needs to replace its existing city tractor which is approximately 50 years old and has reached the end of its useful life. The new tractor will be used for snow removal as well as for general city maintenance. This project will provide upgraded and reliable service for years to come.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct an approximately 76,000 square foot Critical Access Hospital and nursing home for Towner County Hospital Authority (TCHA). The replacement project will consist of 10 bed acute care hospital, a 30 bed long-term care facility, and a five bed basic-care facility. The consolidated replacement of both facilities will bring to Cando, North Dakota, modern, code compliant inpatient and outpatient care spaces, with dramatic improvements in inpatient care, appropriate space for the emergency department and diagnostic imaging, as well as improving other patient care and support areas, in particular, physical therapy, laboratory, ambulatory surgery, and central sterile. The hospital design includes: public spaces, administrative support functions, dietary services, building support, primary clinic space, specialty clinic space, acute care, procedural suites, emergency, x-ray, CT, mammography, ultrasounds, DEXA, EKG, laboratory, and physical therapy. Infection control improvements will be made throughout allowing for proper isolation and ventilation of spaces throughout the facilities.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a 76,000 square foot Critical Access Hospital and nursing home for Towner County Hospital Authority (TCHA). The replacement project will consist of a 10 bed acute care hospital, a 30 bed long term care facility, and a five bed basic care facility. The consolidated replacement of both facilities will bring to Cando, North Dakota, modern, code compliant inpatient and outpatient care spaces, with dramatic improvements in inpatient care, appropriate space for the emergency department and diagnostic imaging, as well as improving other patient care and support areas, in particular, physical therapy, laboratory, ambulatory surgery, and central sterile. The hospital design includes: public spaces, administrative support functions, dietary services, building support, primary clinic space, specialty clinic space, acute care, procedural suites, emergency, x-ray, CT, mammography, ultrasounds, DEXA, EKG, laboratory, and physical therapy. funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) COMBINATION W&W
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for to replace approximately a dozen blocks of Asbestos Cement Pipe on Mayvilles water distribution center as well as install approximately 7 fire hydrants and repair/replace approximately 15 gate valves throughout the city. Funds will also be used to replace sanitary sewer throughout a stretch of town to remedy a sewer break and extend the sewer system to a portion of town. Mayvilles current infrastructure is aging and needs replacement/updating. This project would correct the deficiencies within the Citys existing water and sewer systems to provide a long-term solution for their problems and provide reliable services for the cities approximately 1,900 residents.

project_announced_description: The Rural Development investment will be used to finance street improvements to United Tribes Technical College, located in Bismarck, North Dakota. The project will consist of the reconfiguration of the All Nations Circle and Sisseton Street East Intersection to improve safety and allow for future improvements. Intersections will be revised to create right angled intersections and allow for improved pedestrian bicycle access through campus. Drainage and utility improvements will also occur within the project limits. The entire campus of United Tribes Technical College, which includes about 638 students and faculty/staff, along with any prospective students or visitors would benefit from this improvement.

The revolving loan funds will initially focus on increasing capacity and diversifying Americas food supply chain while furthering economic opportunity with Cloverdale Foods. Lewis & Clark RDC has a 20-year long relationship with Cloverdale Foods firmly rooted in North Dakota. Cloverdale Foods employs residents, is active in attracting new residents to the state, supporting local pork and cattle producers, and investing in communities. These funds will be crucial in assisting Cloverdales growth strategy plan for the next three years. The growth is projected to create 225 new jobs.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) 306C-NATIVE AMERICAN-WASTE ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace and repair the existing wastewater collection system serving a portion of the city of Belcourt, North Dakota. The sanitary sewer in this area of town was installed in the 1960s and is reaching the end of the 50-year design life. The current system has excess infiltration, major dips in pipes, reverse flow, and frozen lines due to improper pipe depth which has resulted in numerous breaks and sewer backups. This project will bring this area of the system up to current standards and increase the quality of service to customers.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) 306C-NATIVE AMERICAN-WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace and repair the existing water distribution system serving a portion of the city of Belcourt. The water main in this area of town was installed in the 1960s and is reaching the end of the 50-year design life. The area has experienced abrupt pipe failures and is difficult to repair due to the obsolescence of the pipe materials. There have also been additional users installed after the system was completed resulting in inadequate pressure and flow requirements. The completion of the project will bring this area of the system up to current standards and increase the quality of service to customers.

naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a more energy- efficient grain drying system. Bruce Teubner operates a family farm, raising small grains near Cando, North Dakota. This project will save the business $7,831 per year and will replace 122,377 kilowatt hours (KWh), (20 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power 11 homes.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase equipment for construction of an approximately 76,000-square-foot Critical Access Hospital (CAH) and nursing home for Towner County Hospital Authority (TCHA) in Cando, North Dakota. The project will consist of a 10-bed acute care hospital; a 30-bed long term care facility; and a 5-bed basic care unit. The hospital design includes public and administrative support spaces, dietary services, infrastructure support, primary clinic space, specialty clinic space, acute care, procedural suites, emergency, x-ray, CT, mammography, ultrasounds, DEXA, EKG, laboratory, and physical therapy. This consolidated-facilities project will establish modern, code-compliant, inpatient and outpatient care areas. This includes dramatic improvements to inpatient care, emergency department, and diagnostic imaging spaces. Upgrades will also occur across multiple patient care and support areas, including physical therapy, laboratory, ambulatory surgery, and central sterile. Infection control improvements such as proper space isolation and ventilation will be made throughout the facilities.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make major renovations and additions to the Northwood Deaconess Health Center (NDHC). The updated facility will include major renovations to the hospital, including the emergency room, procedure suite, imaging, lab, pharmacy, and business office. Based on proposed construction, there will be the ability to add the following much needed services: CT scanning, endoscopy, colonoscopy, infusion, and potential future services of mammography, dermatology, and orthopedics. Post construction NDHC consist of 25 beds, nine acute care beds and 16 swing beds. This project is located in Northwood, North Dakota and will benefit approximately 3,800 rural residents living in Grand Forks County.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist with the expansion of Ray Farmers Union Elevator Company in Ray, North Dakota. The new addition will increase dry fertilizer capacity by 7,025 tons to a total of 11,425 tons. The project will benefit existing and new customers in the North Dakota counties of Williams, Divide, Mountrail, Burke, and McKenzie as well as improve fertilizer supply logistics.
